Html:
Hi Agustin,

I have used "Page" as a view . Open a different pages in the same view and navigate with Page Navigation Button(History). When i again call RequestNavigate Method navigation is not done to the particular page.

Please find the sample under the following location.

Sample Link : http://www.mediafire.com/?zg8p1jefaaocgnt

Replication Procedure Video :  http://www.mediafire.com/?4lm3pxttk344t4u

Hoping for the best Solution.

Thanks and Regards,

Sakthi

Hi,

Based on my understanding you could try using Prism's Journal APIs, as the mechanism to store, replay or pre-define the sequence of navigation. You will find more information about this in the Prism documentation at MSDN:

  • Chapter 8: Navigation, Using the Navigation Journal

Also you can find examples that support this in the following resources:

  • View Switching Navigation Quickstart
  • Navigation Lab, Exercise 4 of the Prism Training Kit

In case this doesn't help, you could debug the call to the RequestNavigate method to find the exact exception that is causing this. Note that you must place a reference to the Prism Library projects instead of the compiled binaries in order to be able to debug that method call. You might find more information about this in the following blog:

  • How to prevent Region Navigation from hiding exceptions in Prism

I hope you find this helpful

Agustin Adami
http://blogs.southworks.net/aadamiï»¿
